ML_AA_NAMES.AA_NAME: NHS Basildon and Thurrock University Hospitals Foundation Trust

CA_CE_CONCESSIONAIRE_PROFILE.ORGANISATION: NHS Basildon and Thurrock University Hospitals Foundation Trust

TITLE_CONTRACT.P: Tender for the provision of a domestic service to Basildon and Thurrock University Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust.

SHORT_CONTRACT_DESCRIPTION.P: To provide a domestic service to Basildon University and Orsett Hospitals and the St. Andrews Centre in Billericay.
All interested suppliers will need to complete a Pre-Qualification Questionnaire (PQQ). Instructions on how to obtain the PQQ is given in VI.3 (Additional Information).

TOTAL_QUANTITY_OR_SCOPE.P: Basildon and Thurrock University Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust ("the Trust") intends to appoint a contractor to provide domestic services at the following locations: Basildon Hospital (including the Essex Cardiothoracic Centre), Orsett Hospital and the St Andrews Centre.

Basildon Hospital is located in Nethermayne, Basildon, Essex and was opened in 1973. Basildon Hospital provides acute district general hospital services and tertiary cardiothoracic services including the following: acute, general medical, surgical, orthopaedic, paediatric, obstetrics and gynaecology, rheumatology and tertiary cardiothoracic. Basildon Hospital provides 641 beds for general and acute services, along with maternity unit and day stay beds. The Essex Cardiothoracic Centre is located on the Basildon Hospital site and has approximately 94 beds. It provides tertiary cardiothoracic services including Primary Percutaneous Coronary Intervention (PPCI). Basildon Hospital has a large Accident and Emergency Department with approximately 90 000 attendances per year. Basildon Hospital also has an Intensive Care Unit, coronary care unit, Renal Unit, Dermatology Unit, Breast Care Unit, Day Surgery Unit, tertiary Cardiothoracic Centre and a purpose built Post Graduate Medical Education Centre on site. There is also staff residential accommodation on site.

Orsett Hospital is located at Rowley Road, Orsett, Essex and provides the following services: Outpatient Department, Eye Clinic, Day Surgery Unit, Renal Dialysis Unit, Minor Injuries Unit, diagnostic facilities and rheumatological services.
The St Andrews Centre is located at Stock Road, Billericay, Essex and provides the following services: X-Ray, blood test, and physiotherapy services.
The above sites cover an area of approximately 137,839 square metres.
Instructions on how to obtain the PQQ is given in VI.3 Additional Information. The PPQ must be completed and submitted by the date in point IV.3.4.

ECONOMIC_OPERATORS_PERSONAL_SITUATION.P: As stated in the PQQ. Instructions on how to obtain the PQQ is given in VI.3 Additional Information. The PPQ must be completed and submitted by the date in point IV.3.4.

ADDITIONAL_INFORMATION.P: The Contracting Authority intends to use an eTendering system in this procurement exercise and reserves the right to use a reverse auction.
Suppliers Instructions How to Express Interest in this Tender:

1. Register your company on the eSourcing portal (this is only required once) - Browse to the eSourcing Portal: https://eoecph.bravosolution.co.uk and click the link to register - Accept the terms and conditions and click "continue" - Enter your correct business and user details - Note the username you chose and click "Save" when complete - You will shortly receive an email with your unique password (please keep this secure).

2. Express an Interest in the tender - Login to the portal with the username/password - Click the "PQQs / ITTs Open To All Suppliers" link. (These are Pre-Qualification Questionnaires or Invitations to Tender open to any registered supplier) - Click on the relevant PQQ/ ITT to access the content. - Click the "Express Interest" button at the top of the page. - This will move the PQQ /ITT into your "My PQQs/ My ITTs" page. (This is a secure area reserved for your projects only) -You can now access any attachments by clicking "Buyer Attachments" in the "PQQ/ ITT Details" box;

3. Responding to the tender - Click "My Response" under "PQQ/ ITT Details", you can choose to "Create Response" or to "Decline to Respond" (please give a reason if declining) - You can now use the "Messages" function to communicate with the buyer and seek any clarification - Note the deadline for completion, then follow the onscreen instructions to complete the PQQ/ ITT - There may be a mixture of online & offline actions for you to perform (there is detailed online help available) You must then submit your reply using the "Submit Response" button at the top of the page. If you require any further assistance please consult the online help, or contact the eTendering help desk.
